instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-34374: What is 820-34374? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS? This is PPBUS_G3H after passing through a current sense resistor that splits it off from the rest of PPBUS_G3H. The purpose of this is so that we can measure how much current is flowing to this part of the machine..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-34374</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground
threads.message:
hi i have got a macbook air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B with liquid damage when you connect it to the charger green/orange light turns on but fan doesn't spin there was some corrosion around <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> and SMC so i cleaned it up, on L7140 i got 1.8V that meant so i removed L7140 and pin number 2 is shorted to ground when i send 4V to pin number 2 the only thing that heats up is the CPU, on the schematic <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> doesn't go to CPU (PCH) also i checked for more shorted lines and i found all of the bellow rails are shorted to ground

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H_R</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS</SIGNAL>
PP1V05_S0_PCH_VCCACLKPLL_R

with diode mode it shows 0010 on both sides

i tried to remove some caps around the CPU but the short is still there, the problem can't find the short by detecting the heat because the only part that gets hot is the PCH

thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-34374</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground
threads.message: Probably <SIGNAL>S5_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> that's shorting ppbus. Check all the tantalum caps on the front side of board...sometimes it's one of them that pops.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-34374</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground
threads.message: Thanks for replying back, i removed all the tantalum caps and the short is still there there are some iC's on <SIGNAL>S5_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> they can cause the short but i'm afraid of the PCH itself is shorted from inside, i looked for corrosion around CPU and it looks clean

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-34374</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground
threads.message: Remove the fuse and check resistance to ground on pins 1 and 2 of where the fuse sits. You should get a short on one side of it. If it's on pin 2, inject low voltage first as the CPU sits on the system side.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-34374</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground
threads.message:
[QUOTE="JohnB8812, post: 35900"]Remove the fuse and check resistance to ground on pins 1 and 2 of where the fuse sits. You should get a short on one side of it. If it's on pin 2, inject low voltage first as the CPU sits on the system side.[/QUOTE]

yes i already did that and pin two is shorted to ground and when i inject voltage in only the CPU gets hot

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-34374</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground
threads.message: High side FET in CPU Vcore supply shorted. CPU is dead already so this board can RIP.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-34374</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground
threads.message:
i injected 3.7V to PP1V05_S0_PCH_VCCACLKPLL_R and <CHIP>U8080</CHIP> got hot but <CHIP>U8080</CHIP> is not connected to PP1V05_S0_PCH_VCCACLKPLL_R directly so i checked the cap beside it (<CAPACITOR>C8081</CAPACITOR>) that has <SIGNAL>P5VS0_FET_RAMP</SIGNAL> on it and it was shorted to ground i removed <CHIP>U8080</CHIP> the short on  <SIGNAL>P5VS0_FET_RAMP</SIGNAL> and PP1V05_S0_PCH_VCCACLKPLL_R is gone but the short on 
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H_R</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS</SIGNAL>

is still there

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-34374</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 35940"]High side FET in CPU Vcore supply shorted. CPU is dead already so this board can RIP.[/QUOTE]

Thanks for that mate you saved my time i doubted the CPU itself can be shorted but i wan't sure, now i can give up on this and work on something else thanks alot
